borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed outbuilding has not been satisfactorily demonstrated to be ancillary to the host dwelling house and would constitute a form of backland development. Therefore by reason of additional comings and goings and a harmful loss of privacy from the creation of self-contained living space within the garden, the proposed development is considered contrary to the development plan. Specifically:</p><p>National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>

<p>The proposed outbuilding represents poor quality development which would result in an increased sense of overbearingness, overshadowing and a loss of outlook to neighbouring properties. Therefore constituting an unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policy DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</p>
description:
Construction of Annex/outbuilding to provide additional accommodation in connection with the main
house for the family. It would comprise two bedrooms and a shower / toilet room
